page.title: 18GROWERS CO-OPERATIVE
page.content: The horticultural nature of the area is typified by a Growers Co-operative called Littleton and Badsey Growers. The Co-operative was started in 1908 by Charles Binyon and in 1985, 1260 growers are using the facilities for bulk buying and co-operative marketing. The present site covers some 12 acres of ground and although some of the buildings are old,new warehouses are being added. The Co-operative has recently installed (at the expense of 16,000) a vacuum cooler to give a better shelf life to green leaved vegetables. The co-operative have more expensive equipment, installed some years ago, in the form of a herb dryer which processes most of the dried herbs at present sold in this country. L.B.G lorries serve the U.K and occasionally go to the continent.
